rules.description: Use meaningful variable and function names that clearly describe their purpose.
Ensure consistent indentation using 4 spaces per indentation level.
Avoid using hard-coded values; instead, use constants or configuration files.
Write modular code by breaking down large functions into smaller, reusable components.
Include comments and docstrings to explain complex logic and function purposes.
Handle exceptions gracefully and provide meaningful error messages.
Adhere to the project's coding style guidelines, such as PEP 8 for Python.
Write unit tests for new features and ensure existing tests pass after changes.
Remove unused code and dependencies to keep the codebase clean and maintainable.
Optimize performance by avoiding unnecessary computations and using efficient algorithms.
